page.title: 08Pontefract Road
page.content: You see, the problem is there is nothing there! One{power station,}one {sewage works}and a bit of{fishing recreation and that's it. Nevertheless, an interesting area, even though we got nettled and covered in wet coal sludge. A fascinating area: high-powered (sic) industry & modern technology alongside the examples of dereliction and disuse and, overlooking all, one of the products of the seventeenth century:{Temple Newsam House. We actually walked right through the area to{Pontefract Road.}We a little of one of the squares, but from talking to the CEGB man on the dump it would seem to be one vast{open-cast {mine.}We logged it as a colliery. It is known as the Ox-bow site. .
